data.meta_description: Discover life events, stories and photos about Prime Minister John George Diefenbaker PC, CH, QC, FRSC, FRSA (1895â1979) of Neustadt, West Grey, Grey, Ontario, Canada.
data.text:
When Prime Minister John George Diefenbaker PC, CH, QC, FRSC, FRSA was born on 18 September 1895, in Neustadt, West Grey, Grey, Ontario, Canada, his father, William Thomas Diefenbaker, was 27 and his mother, Mary Florence Bannerman, was 22. He married Edna May Brower on 29 June 1929, in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. He lived in Ontario, Canada in 1979 and Ottawa, Ontario, Canada in 1979. He registered for military service in 1916. In 1957, his occupation is listed as prime minister of canada in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. He died on 16 August 1979, in Rockcliffe Park, Ottawa, Ottawa-Carleton, Ontario, Canada, at the age of 83, and was buried in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada.

1906 Â· Hydro-Electric of Ontario

Ontario Hydro was established in 1906. It is the Hydro-Electric Power Commission of Ontario.

1913 Â· Women's Suffrage Demonstration

A demonstration for women's suffrage takes place on March 3, 1913. This is the first suffrage parade in Washington D.C. One of the notable women in attendance is Ida B. Wells.

1923 Â· First Presidential Radio Broadcast

"On December 6, 1923, President Calvin Coolidge delivered the first presidential radio broadcast. It was covered by 42 stations and became known as the ""State of the Union"" address."
